edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.dlog
Class SigmaDlogVerifierComputation

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.dlog.SigmaDlogVerifierComputation
All Implemented Interfaces:
DlogBasedSigma, SigmaVerifierComputation
public class SigmaDlogVerifierComputation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaVerifierComputation, DlogBasedSigma

Concrete implementation of Sigma Protocol verifier computation.

This protocol is used for a prover to convince a verifier that it knows the discrete log of the value h in G.

This implementation is based on Schnorr's sigma protocol for Dlog Group, see reference in Protocol 6.1.1, page 148 of Hazay-Lindell..

The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 1.1 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

verify

public boolean verify(SigmaCommonInput input,
                      SigmaProtocolMsg a,
                      SigmaProtocolMsg z)
Verifies the proof.

Computes the following line from the protocol:

"ACC IFF VALID_PARAMS(G,q,g) = TRUE AND h in G AND g^z = ah^e".

Specified by:
verify in interface SigmaVerifierComputation
Parameters:
a - first message from prover
z - second message from prover
input - MUST be an instance of SigmaDlogCommonInput.
Returns:
true if the proof has been verified; false, otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not an instance of SigmaDlogCommonInput.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the first message of the prover is not an instance of SigmaGroupElementMsg
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the second message of the prover is not an instance of SigmaBIMsg
